summary: An email from an FBI Special Agent in Charge requesting the release of the final medical examiner's report on Jeffrey Epstein's death to Detective Paul Courtney of the NYPD, who is assigned to the FBI's Violent Crimes Task Force. The email is forwarded to another FBI agent.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the medical examiner's report regarding his death on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Paul Courtney
persons.context: Member of the NYPD assigned to work with the FBI's Violent Crimes Task Force; requested recipient of the medical examiner's report.

persons.name: kjponder
persons.role: Supervisory Special Agent, FBI/NYPD Violent Crimes Task Force
persons.context: Email recipient; appears to be the forwarder of the original message.

connections.description: Both are law enforcement officers working on the FBI/NYPD Violent Crimes Task Force.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died; a final medical examiner's report was prepared regarding his death.

events.title: Request for Medical Examiner Report
events.description: An FBI Special Agent in Charge emails a request for the release of the final ME report on Epstein's death to Detective Paul Courtney.

keyFacts: The document is a forwarded email dated August 28, 2019, concerning the release of the final medical examiner's report on Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The request is made by an FBI Special Agent in Charge to have the report released to NYPD Detective Paul Courtney, who is assigned to the FBI's Violent Crimes Task Force.
Jeffrey Epstein's death occurred on August 10, 2019, and a final report was prepared by the medical examiner's office.
The email indicates coordination between the FBI and NYPD via the Violent Crimes Task Force regarding the investigation into Epstein's death.
